intro: Pentaphyllum effusum, commonly known as the silky filbert, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other herbaceous plants. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and leaves that are often lobed or divided. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, with five sepals and numerous stamens. Pentaphyllum effusum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
